value.title: Signal AI opens External Intelligence Graph for enterprise use
value.excerpt: Signal AI unveiled its new tool, a data structure that constantly tracks the major and minor events for companies that course through the news sphere each day.

value.title: Open source isn’t working for AI
value.excerpt: What’s the point of open sourcing code that runs at a scale no one can replicate? AI needs collaboration, but let’s think about it differently.

value.title: Perceptron: AI that solves math problems, translates 200 languages, and draws kangaroos
value.excerpt: In this edition of Perceptron, TechCrunch's AI research roundup, we look at new language models from Microsoft and Meta as well as a Google system that can solve quantitative reasoning problems.

value.title: Meta’s new open-source AI is a step towards a universal language translator
value.excerpt: The company has open-sourced an AI model that translates over 200 languages — many of which aren't supported by existing systems.

value.title: Meta’s AI machine translation research helps break language barriers in Africa
value.excerpt: In an effort to develop high-quality machine translation capabilities for most of the world’s low-resource languages, this single AI model was designed with a focus on African languages. They are challenging from a machine translation perspective.

value.title: Meta’s open-source AI model leaves no language behind
value.excerpt: Meta announced a breakthrough in its No Language Left Behind initiative — a single AI model that translates over 200 different languages.

value.title: Meta’s new AI research may boost translations on Facebook, Instagram
value.excerpt: Facebook's parent company Meta has announced a new AI model for language translation and its research could improve translation on Facebook and Instagram.

value.title: Meta's 'No Language Left Behind' AI Can Now Translate 200 Languages
value.excerpt: The translation tool will be put to work on Facebook and Instagram and will also be open source for others to use.

value.title: The Fight Over Which Uses of AI Europe Should Outlaw
value.excerpt: The European Union’s AI Act will set ground rules for what the technology can and can’t do to people—like whether it’s OK to deploy AI lie detectors at borders.

value.title: Why synthetic data makes real AI better
value.excerpt: When combined with real data, synthetic data creates an enhanced dataset that often can mitigate the weaknesses of the real data."

value.title: Instagram is testing AI that verifies your age with a selfie scan. It's not perfect
value.excerpt: Instagram is testing new ways to verify its youngest users' ages, including by using artificial intelligence that analyzes a photo and estimates how old the user is.

value.title: Instagram tests using AI, other tools for age verification
value.excerpt: By BARBARA ORTUTAY and MATT O’BRIEN AP Technology Writers Instagram is testing new ways to verify the age of people using its service, including a face-scanning artificial intelligence tool, having mutual friends verify their age or uploading an ID.

value.title: The Power and Pitfalls of AI for US Intelligence
value.excerpt: From cyber operations to disinformation, artificial intelligence extends the reach of national security threats that can target individuals and whole societies with precision, speed, and scale. As the US competes to stay ahead,

value.title: AI’s hold over humans is starting to get stronger
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence isn’t on the cusp of sentience. But its growing inscrutability and sway over us should still be cause for concern

value.title: Parmy Olson: AI’s hold over humans is starting to get stronger
value.excerpt: It has been an exasperating week for computer scientists. They’ve been falling over each other to publicly denounce claims from Google engineer Blake Lemoine, chronicled in a Washington Post report,

value.title: AI’s hold over humans is getting stronger
value.excerpt: The question of whether computers will ever feel is awkward and thorny, in large part because there’s little scientific consensus on how consciousness in humans works.

value.title: AI’s Hold Over Humans Is Starting to Get Stronger
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence isn’t on the cusp of sentience. But its growing inscrutability and sway over us should still be cause for concern.
